name: Khanom Tom Recipe (Thai Coconut Balls Dessert)
description: This khanom tom recipe is traditional, fun to make, and super delicious. Make it with the kids and you'll have a blast.

itemListElement.text: Place a wok or skillet over medium heat and combine coconut water, palm sugar, and salt. Cook until the mixture begins to bubble and thicken.
itemListElement.name: Place a wok or skillet over medium heat and combine coconut water, palm sugar, and salt. Cook until the mixture begins to bubble and thicken.

itemListElement.text: Stir in the shredded coconut and continue to cook. Once bubbles surface, prolong the cooking until the mixture becomes sticky in texture.
itemListElement.name: Stir in the shredded coconut and continue to cook. Once bubbles surface, prolong the cooking until the mixture becomes sticky in texture.

itemListElement.text: Continue to cook and stir the mixture until the liquid is fully absorbed, ensuring it does not dry out completely.

itemListElement.text: Once done, transfer the mixture to a baking dish and allow it to cool down.

itemListElement.text: Prepare the white dough by combining glutinous rice flour and coconut milk in a large mixing bowl, kneading the mixture until a dough forms.
itemListElement.name: Prepare the white dough by combining glutinous rice flour and coconut milk in a large mixing bowl, kneading the mixture until a dough forms.

itemListElement.text: For the green dough, blend pandan leaves with water and strain the mixture through a sieve cloth to remove impurities and extract the pandan juice. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of the pandan extract, coconut milk, and glutinous rice flour, kneading them together to form a dough.

itemListElement.text: Set a pot on medium heat and add water along with butterfly pea flowers. The water will turn blue; once it does, introduce fresh lime juice until the liquid changes to purple. In a mixing bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of this purple liquid, coconut milk, and glutinous rice flour, kneading them together to form a dough.

itemListElement.text: Place the ball-shaped filling at the center of the flattened dough.

itemListElement.text: Fold the dough around the ball, sealing it.

itemListElement.text: Fill a pot or a wok with water and place it over high heat.

itemListElement.text: Gently lower the coconut balls into the boiling water. Once they float to the surface, cook for 5 more minutes.

itemListElement.text: Mix salt with shredded coconut to prepare the filling.

itemListElement.text: Spread some of the coconut filling on a tray. As soon as the coconut balls finish cooking, place them over the filling, making sure each ball is topped with the shredded coconut.
